keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support local businesses and enterprise providing jobs, wealth, and innovation.
Ensure investment in new technologies and energy efficiency within the constituency.
Promote quality public services which reflect the real needs of individuals and families.
Continue to campaign for reliable, affordable public transport including the expansion of local rail services.
Promises to enable Bristol West residents in work, remaining accessible and locally accountable.

issues.education: As a teacher and a parent I believe that good quality education is essential for a fair, more equal society and a healthy economy. I will work to protect and expand ‘Sure Start’ centres; Bristol’s schools and Sure Start centres.
issues.environment: Having qualified as a scientist and worked for four years in the environmental sector I am committed to the development of new technologies which use resources and generates green jobs that help to do this.

leaflet.personalStatement: People tell me they want to live in a future Britain with the chance of a good job, first-class education, genuine fairness, speedy public services and homes that are affordable for everyone, not just the privileged few. I live in Bristol West and I've campaigned to improve things we all care about like jobs, housing and the environment for over 20 years.

endorsements.endorsement: Paul Smith has the experience, commitment and vision needed to represent Bristol West residents in parliament.

images.caption: Paul Smith and Candidate Visited a Local Solar Energy Project
